==Description== '''Pokérus''' is a microscopic life-form that can attach to Pokémon. Your Kanto Starter Pokémon will automatically be infected with Pokérus upon clearing the [[Distortion World]] [[Dungeons|Dungeon]] in [[Sinnoh]] for the first time. Pokérus is a beneficial virus to any Pokémon that catches it. Once a Pokémon is infected by the Pokérus, it may gain Effort Values (EVs), which multiplicatively increase the attack of that Pokémon via the [[Pokérus#EV Damage Multiplier|EV Damage Multiplier]].
==Spreading Pokérus== Spreading Pokérus can only occur in the [[Pokémon Day Care]]. Currently, only a Pokémon that fulfill the below conditions are capable of spreading the virus:
'''''Spreader Requirements''''' #infected with Pokérus #''Contagious'' (see [[Pokérus#Pokérus States|Pokérus States]]) #Not ready to hatch #Being bred manually (ie: a hatchery helper is not assisting with its egg)
Only Pokémon that fulfill the below conditions are capable of contracting the virus:
'''''Contraction Requirements''''' #Not ready to hatch #Share at least one type with a Pokémon that fulfills the "Spreader Requisites"
If all of the above conditions are met, an uninfected Pokémon will automatically catch Pokérus upon gaining any number of egg steps. Pokémon in the Hatchery Queue will not catch Pokérus.
==Pokérus States== There are 4 states of Pokérus as described below.
{| class="wikitable" ! State || Description |- | None || Base State. Pokémon can contract Pokérus. Pokémon cannot gain EVs. |- | [[File:Pokérus (infected).png|20px]] Infected || Pokémon has contracted Pokérus, but has yet to hatch once after contracting the virus. Pokémon cannot gain EVs. |- | [[File:Pokérus (contagious).png|20px]] Contagious || Pokémon has contracted Pokérus, and is capable of spreading the virus. Pokémon can gain EVs. |- | [[File:Pokérus (cured).png|20px]] Cured || Pokémon has contracted Pokérus, and is capable of spreading the virus. Pokémon can gain EVs, and has also accumulated 50 or more EVs. |- |}
==Effort Values (EVs)== EVs are a damage multiplying stat for each individual Pokémon that can be seen in the Pokédex page for that Pokémon and by using the ''Display Value'' setting in the Hatchery. EVs for a Pokémon can currently only be increased by obtaining that Pokémon again after it has caught the Pokérus. You can gain EVs for a Pokémon by: catching it on a [[Route Statistics|Route]] or a [[Dungeon]], obtaining it as a [[Wandering Pokemon]], or by evolving it using [[Evolution Items]]. [[Breeding]] a Pokémon does not count towards gaining EVs. EV gain is further affected by the [[Rowap|Rowap Berry Aura]]. See [[Farming Setups#Maximizing EV Gain|Farming Setups]] for an optimized EV gain farm setup.
====EVs erlangen==== Die Methode wie, bzw. wo ein Pokémon gefangen wird, beeinflusst die Menge an EV, die gewonnen werden. Wenn die [[Challenge Mode|Slow EVs Challenge]] aktiviert ist, werden immer 10x weniger EV gewonnen.
''Hinweis: Wird ein Shiny Pokémon gefangen, werden immer 5x so viele gewonnen, als in der Tabelle angegeben.'' {| class="wikitable" ! EVs gained || Slow EV Challenge || Fangmethode |- | 0.1 || 0.01 || Route Pokémon |- | 0.2 || 0.02 || Dungeon Pokémon |- | 1 || 0.1 || Evolutions Item |}

EVs gained || Slow EV Challenge || Catching Method |- | 0.1 || 0.01 || Route Pokémon |- | 1 || 0.1 || [[Evolution Items|Evolution Item]] |- | 1 || 0.1 || [[Shops|Shop bought Pokémon]] |- | 1 || 0.1 || [[Safari Zone|Safari Zone Pokémon]] |- | 0.5 || 0.05 || [[Wandering Pokemon]] |}
====EV Modifiers==== {| class="wikitable" |+ EV Yield Modifiers ! EV Modifier || Method |- | 3x || Pokémon is encountered and captured as a [[Dungeons|Dungeon Pokémon]] |- | 10x || Pokémon is encountered and captured as a [[Dungeons|Dungeon Boss Pokémon]] |- | 5x || Obtained Pokémon is [[Shiny Chance|Shiny]]. |- | 5x || Pokémon is obtained using a [[Repeatball]] |- | 50x || Pokémon is encountered and captured as a [[Roaming Pokemon]] |- | Variable || [[Rowap|Rowap Berry Aura]] |}
====Examples==== Example 1: Catching a '''Shiny Dungeon Pokémon''' with a [[Repeatball]] yields: 3 * 5 = 15 EVs

Example 2: Catching a '''Shiny Roaming Pokémon''' yields: 5 * 50 = 250 EVs

Example 3: Catching a '''Shiny Roaming Pokémon''' with a [[Repeatball]] yields: 5 * 5 * 50 = 1250 EVs
====EV Schadensmultiplikator==== EVs helfen dem Spieler, indem Sie den Schaden eines Pokémons erhöhen. der Maximale Multiplikator für den Schaden, durch EVs, ist x2. Solange die EV unter 50 sind, bekommt das Pokémon 1% extra Schaden pro EV. Beispiel: Mit 5 EV, würde das Pokémon 105% (1,05x) seines normalen Schadens ausrichten. {| class="wikitable" ! Effort Value || Pokémon Schadensmultiplikator |- | 50 || 1.5x |- | 85 || 1.6x |- | 172 || 1.7x |- | 375 || 1.8x |- | 824 || 1.9x |- | 1770 || 2x |}
{| class="wikitable" |+EV Attack Bonus at certain benchmarks ! Effort Value || Pokémon Damage Multiplier |- | 50 || 1.5x |- | 85 || 1.6x |- | 172 || 1.7x |- | 375 || 1.8x |- | 824 || 1.9x |- | 1770 || 2x |}
====EV Formeln==== '''Solange die Effort Values (EV) unter 50 sind:'''
\colorbox{White}{$ \text{EV Damage Multiplier} = 1 + (\text{EV} / 100)$}

'''Sobald die Effort Value (EV) 50 oder höher sind:'''
\colorbox{White}{$ \text{EV Damage Multiplier} = 1 + \text{Min}(1, ((\text{EV} - 30)^{0.075} - 0.75 ))$}
